Kerry may be next secretary of defense

Although Senator John F. Kerry is thought to covet the job of secretary of state, President Obama is considering asking him to be defense secretary in a vast rearrangement of the national security team. (The Washington Post)
  • Kerry appointment would put focus on Gov. Patrick

Globe editor to become editor of Washington Post

Martin Baron, who oversaw the Globe when it won six Pulitzer Prizes, will become the executive editor of The Washington Post. (Globe, 11:49 a.m.)
  • Video Globe editor announces move to Washington Post
Pictures | Odd Massachusetts laws

You can't do that (in Massachusetts)

Laws from the 17th century -- that are still on the books -- forbid swearing at sports events, laying around, making out in public, and scaring other people's pigeons.
  • Retailers say Mass. blue laws are archaic
  • Share Write your own Mass. blue law

Thomas Hunt was killed early today when fire raced through his third floor condo unit on Columbia Street, officials said. (Globe, 9:32 a.m.)
